summary: what i truly love about childrens media slowly adopting lgbt+ themes is how well they seem to be doing it like. its always so...
body: what i truly love about childrens media slowly adopting lgbt+ themes is how well they seem to be doing it like. its always so casual, no ‘very special message’ episode stuff, no big flashy reveal, its presented as just so natural and normal and real that kids arent even expected to question it. its just There. like, theres nothing Wrong with making it more of a learning experience, kids are curious and love having questions answered, but just representing it as something as normal as any other couple really feels like the best outcome if we want it to result in kids having basic respect for lgbt+ people. if its made into a right vs wrong, good vs bad debate then often times bigoted parents get in the way, or kids feel pressured to think one way or another and end up trying to ‘stay out of it’. my gay ass ‘stayed out of’ politics until i was 11 ish, which of course to me, included lgbt+ rights, but seeing gay people as people isnt political. its not a fight. its just There. kids seeing positive representation, and not being asked to feel a certain way about it, but just to witness it, is an incredible way to normalize lgbt+ people in childrens eyes and frankly just let them know that we exist. we are humans, here we are, and for kids, thats usually All it takes to start a line of acceptance. having people understand that we are people is always the first step, and honestly what an amazing time we live in where we get to see ourselves as people in the medias we grew up with. it really just makes my heart swell

reblog.comment: what i truly love about childrens media slowly adopting lgbt+ themes is how well they seem to be doing it like. its always so casual, no ‘very special message’ episode stuff, no big flashy reveal, its presented as just so natural and normal and real that kids arent even expected to question it. its just There. like, theres nothing Wrong with making it more of a learning experience, kids are curious and love having questions answered, but just representing it as something as normal as any other couple really feels like the best outcome if we want it to result in kids having basic respect for lgbt+ people. if its made into a right vs wrong, good vs bad debate then often times bigoted parents get in the way, or kids feel pressured to think one way or another and end up trying to ‘stay out of it’. my gay ass ‘stayed out of’ politics until i was 11 ish, which of course to me, included lgbt+ rights, but seeing gay people as people isnt political. its not a fight. its just There. kids seeing positive representation, and not being asked to feel a certain way about it, but just to witness it, is an incredible way to normalize lgbt+ people in childrens eyes and frankly just let them know that we exist. we are humans, here we are, and for kids, thats usually All it takes to start a line of acceptance. having people understand that we are people is always the first step, and honestly what an amazing time we live in where we get to see ourselves as people in the medias we grew up with. it really just makes my heart swell

blog.name: mackmeta
blog.title: Meta, Analysis, and Speculation
blog.description: I'm Dave (he/him). I'm a fan of Andi Mack, Riverdale, and Girl Meets World, and other shows and movies. Feel free to send me asks!

summary: Follow up to my last ask but why do you think the cast showed off so much of their wardrobe when that spoils a lot of plots?
question: Follow up to my last ask but why do you think the cast showed off so much of their wardrobe when that spoils a lot of plots?
answer:
In fairness to the cast, they oftentimes did make sure we didn’t see their wardrobes, for example we never saw a single photo of Lilan on set for the original Bexie wedding in 3x18 which of course was to hide the wedding dress. And most of the pics we have from that week came from Trent, if he hadn’t leaked we would actually have very little. The biggest issue they had is that different cast and crew would post photos often days or weeks after an ep had been filmed that showed off different bits of the ep. My favourite example is from 3x19 which I discussed previously. These photos from Asher, Anson’s family, and Paul Hoen don’t really give much away on their own but Anson’s photo acts as a Rosetta stone of sorts for 3x19 when viewed with the other photos:

With Anson’s photo revealing that Cyrus has a theatre event we can piece together that it’s the same day as the game and that TJ attends both. We already knew 3x19 was TJ’s first ep since 3x15 and the first ep after the original wedding but now that we’ve seen up to 3x13 we can see that Cyrus having an event of his own and TJ being there is in fact very important for their story line. As is Cyrus ending up happy onstage in 3x19 when he was almost in tears onstage at the end of 3x13. 

The cast also can’t really do anything about the lag time between filming and airing which allows us to look ahead and realize some scenes must be fairly important. It’s very unusual for Andi, Cyrus, Jonah, and TJ to all hang out in the same scene (it’s only happened once before in 2x22) but just knowing that they hang together isn’t that much of a spoiler. It only becomes one with the eps we’ve seen and what we learned from later production: that Jonah and TJ are now friends, that Jonah knows Cyrus is gay, that Andi on the texts has clued into TJ’s crush, that Jonah sings You Girl to Andi the very next ep and Tyrus canons the ep after, and that this was the last ep they filmed at the school (before the re-shoots anyway).

It’s very unusual for Andi, Cyrus, Jonah, and TJ to all hang out in the same scene (it’s only happened once before in 2x22) but just knowing that they hang together isn’t that much of a spoiler. blog.name: kippen-goodman-stan
blog.title: Tyrus!!!
blog.description: Of course I came

summary: 50 days of Andi Mack
body:
50 days of Andi Mack

Season 2 Episode 1: Hey, Who Wants Pizza

  • “This is my… Iris” He looked so awkward saying that omg
  • Iris was just spilling all the tea about Amber to And and Buffy of all people. I thought she was supposed to be her friend!
  • “I’d say I’m t-rexcited” “Then let’s diplodocus saurock this!” Cute dinosaur puns I love it!
  • “They’re drinking tea and talking plants? This is the most boring miracle I’ve ever seen” Bex’s lines are so underrated
  • Isn’t it weird that the Ciris kiss was less awkward than the Jandi kiss?
  • I love how Cyrus instantly goes to Jonah to tell him he kissed Iris and then just smiles at him like a dork for the rest of the scene
  • Cyrus saying “pooh” while Buffy literally carried him away was just amazing
  • Bex’s coin trick was actually really smart
  • Cyrus looked so happy when he got called up onto the stage and when he hugged Jonah I just sjsdjdhf God I feel like I’m a Jyrus shipper all over again
  • Buffy fangirling over Jandi is me fangirling over Cyrus any time I see him on screen
  • Omigod I forgot that scene was in this episode!!
  • I still can’t believe how tastefully that scene was done. It was really beautiful and I am just so proud of Andi Mack for doing this. Thinking about how something like this can change people’s lives is so inspiring, and I was brought to tears even though I’ve watched it so many times before. OK I’m done.
  • I hate how Andi was just there interfering with the proposal
  • THE ORIGINAL UM!!!
  • Buffy called Jandi excruciating to make Cyrus feel better, I call it excruciating because they are
  • Cyrus acted so mature about Jandi I just love him so much!!!
  • “I want simple, yet classy. Timeless, yet never been done” Britney, um…
  • Dimples
  • Wow, Britney’s b&w look slayed
  • “I’m not 40! You think I’m 40?!!“
  • "I really like that you’re so uncomplicated” If only she knew…
  • “As you get to know me you’re going to have to spell out fewer and fewer of my jokes”
  • Back to the future tater theater!!!
  • “We’re not just friends. We’re like a really small gang. And when she’s sad… Let’s just say you don’t want to see me when she’s sad” Wow, Buffy can be really scary
  • I really expected Jonah to say Docious Magocious after saying he says embarrassing things all the the time

  • Omigod I forgot that scene was in this episode!!
  • I still can’t believe how tastefully that scene was done. It was really beautiful and I am just so proud of Andi Mack for doing this. Thinking about how something like this can change people’s lives is so inspiring, and I was brought to tears even though I’ve watched it so many times before. OK I’m done.
  • I hate how Andi was just there interfering with the proposal
  • THE ORIGINAL UM!!!
  • Buffy called Jandi excruciating to make Cyrus feel better, I call it excruciating because they are
  • Cyrus acted so mature about Jandi I just love him so much!!!
  • “I want simple, yet classy. Timeless, yet never been done” Britney, um…
  • Dimples
  • Wow, Britney’s b&w look slayed
  • “I’m not 40! You think I’m 40?!!“
  • "I really like that you’re so uncomplicated” If only she knew…
  • “As you get to know me you’re going to have to spell out fewer and fewer of my jokes”
  • Back to the future tater theater!!!
  • “We’re not just friends. We’re like a really small gang. And when she’s sad… Let’s just say you don’t want to see me when she’s sad” Wow, Buffy can be really scary
  • I really expected Jonah to say Docious Magocious after saying he says embarrassing things all the the time
